metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2274 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: The OpenSSL 3.0.4 release introduced a serious bug in the RSA implementation for X86_64 CPUs supporting the AVX512IFMA instructions. This issue makes the RSA implementation with 2048 bit private keys incorrect on such machines and memory corruption will happen during the computation. As a consequence of the memory corruption an attacker may be able to trigger a remote code execution on the machine performing the computation. SSL/TLS servers or other servers using 2048 bit RSA private keys running on machines supporting AVX512IFMA instructions of the X86_64 architecture are affected by this issue.

notes.Note: sbeattie> introduced in 10d8a109be0fe50315e4eeb0676f6571914cd47a (v3.0.4) mdeslaur> This was fixed in d/p/fix-avx512-overflow.patch

criterions.comment: edk2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
